name: preclusive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
preventing something from happening, or making it impossible for it to happen : preclusive effect Declaring that the issue was one of preclusion, the court decided that there was no preclusive effect.preclusive of In his mind it was a minor change, and not preclusive of his long-standing radical beliefs.
More examplesFewer examplesYou should be aware that a guilty plea will have a preclusive effect on your insurance coverage.A judgment based on a civil verdict may be preclusive of issues in a later case, even where some of the parties differ.
